# {{senseid|en|Q283}}{{lb|en|uncountable}} A substance (of molecular formula H<sub>2</sub>O) found at [[room temperature]] and pressure as a clear [[liquid]]; it is present naturally as [[rain#Noun|rain]], and found in [[river]]s, [[lake]]s and [[sea]]s; its solid form is [[ice#Noun|ice]] and its gaseous form is [[steam#Noun|steam]].
#: {{ux|en|By the action of electricity, the '''water''' was resolved into its two parts, oxygen and hydrogen.}}
#* '''1805''' December, Julius Griffiths, "A Journey across the Desert", ''The Monthly Mirror...'', p. 362:
#*: It is wholly out of the power of language to convey any idea of the blissful enjoyment of obtaining '''water''', after an almost total want of it, during eight and forty hours, in the scorching regions of an Arabian desert, in the month of July.
#* {{quote-journal|en|year=2013|month=September-October|author=[http://www.americanscientist.org/authors/detail/katie-l-burke Katie L. Burke]| magazine=w:American Scientist| title=[http://www.americanscientist.org/issues/pub/2013/5/in-the-news-47 In the News]| passage=Oxygen levels on Earth skyrocketed 2.4 billion years ago, when cyanobacteria evolved photosynthesis: the ability to convert '''water''' and carbon dioxide into carbohydrates and waste oxygen using solar energy.}}
## {{lb|en|uncountable|in particular}} The liquid form of this substance: liquid H<sub>2</sub>O.
##: {{ux|en|May I have a glass of '''water'''?}}
##: {{ux|en|Your plants need more '''water'''.}}

|passage=Towards the following morning, the thermometer fell to 5¬∞; and at daylight, there was not an atom of '''water''' to be seen in any direction.}}

|passage=A '''water''' drop placed on the surface of ice can either spread or form a lens depending on the properties of the three phases involved in wetting, i.e., on the properties of the ice, '''water''', and gas phases.}}
##* {{quote-journal|en|date=2013-05-11|volume=407|issue=8835|page=80|magazine=w:The Economist| title=[http://www.economist.com/news/science-and-technology/21577341-worlds-third-largest-area-ice-about-undergo-systematic The climate of Tibet: Pole-land]| passage=Of all the transitions brought about on the Earth‚Äôs surface by temperature change, the melting of ice into '''water''' is the starkest. ====Verb====
{{en-verb}}
[[Image:To water the coffee tree in dry season.jpg|thumb|right|to water (1)]]

# {{lb|en|transitive}} To pour water into the [[soil#Noun|soil]] surrounding (plants).
#* {{quote-book|en|year=1900|author=L. Frank Baum|title=The Wonderful Wizard of Oz|chapter=24|passage=Aunt Em had just come out of the house to '''water''' the cabbages when she looked up and saw Dorothy running toward her.}}
# {{lb|en|transitive}} To [[wet#Verb|wet]] or supply with water; to [[moisten]]; to overflow with water; to [[irrigate]].
#* {{RQ:Milton Paradise Lost|book=9|passage=tears '''watering''' the ground|year=1873}}
#* {{RQ:Longfellow Evangeline|I
|passage=Men whose lives glided on like rivers that '''water''' the woodlands.}}
# {{senseid|en|to provide with water}} {{lb|en|transitive}} To provide (animals) with water for [[drink#Verb|drink]]ing.
#: {{ux|en|I need to '''water''' the cattle.}}
#* {{quote-book|en|year=2008| title=Mopus|author=Oisin Curran | page=34| passage=While they '''watered''' and washed their horses, I talked with a red-capped man, some kind of chief.}}
# {{lb|en|intransitive}} To get or take in water.
#: {{ux|en|The ship put into port to '''water'''.}}
#* {{quote-journal|en|year=1944|month=January and February|author=W. McGowan Gradon|title=Forres as a Railway Centre|journal=Railway Magazine|page=23|text=After working the 1.30 p.m. through train from Forres to Aberdeen as far as Elgin, she returns tender first with a local passenger train and is then coaled and '''watered''' at Forres shed, and eventually works back to Perth on the 10.20 p.m. through freight.}}
# {{lb|en|transitive|colloquial}} To [[urinate]] onto.
#: {{ux|en|[[nature calls|Nature called]], so I stepped into the woods and '''watered''' a tree.}}
# {{lb|en|transitive}} To [[dilute]].
#: {{ux|en|Can you '''water''' the whisky, please?}}
# {{lb|en|transitive|dated|finance}} To overvalue (securities), especially through deceptive accounting.
#* {{quote-journal|en|title=Calls Rail Holding Companies Threat|work=The Sun| date=April 10, 1930| passage=such agencies would make it possible for the railroads to '''water''' stock and evade the law subjecting security issues to public regulation}}
# {{lb|en|intransitive}} To fill with or secrete water or similar liquid.
#: {{ux|en|Chopping onions makes my eyes '''water'''.}}
#: {{ux|en|The smell of fried onions makes my mouth '''water'''.}}
# {{lb|en|transitive}} To wet and [[calender]], as cloth, so as to impart to it a [[lustrous]] appearance in [[wavy]] lines; to [[diversify]] with wavelike lines.
#: {{ux|en|to '''water''' silk}}
